terms.description: Voxd AI LTD, a company incorporated in England and Wales, with company registration number [PENDING].
Any business, company, partnership, or other legal entity that purchases or uses the Services under these Terms, excluding consumers.
The bespoke AI-powered chatbot configuration, setup, integration, and related services provided by Voxd to the Client, as described in these Terms and the applicable Order Form.

A document issued by Voxd and digitally signed by the Client which sets out the commercial terms applicable to the Services, including fees, scope, and the Initial Term, and which incorporates these Terms and Conditions by reference.
The minimum commitment period for the Services, as specified in the applicable Order Form.

Any services, platforms, APIs, software, infrastructure, or providers that are not owned or controlled by Voxd, including but not limited to WhatsApp, Meta Platforms, LLM providers, hosting providers, and integrated systems.
Any third party that provides a Third-Party Service used in connection with the Services.

Any responses, messages, classifications, recommendations, actions, or other outputs generated, suggested, or delivered by artificial intelligence or machine-learning systems used in connection with the Services.
A third-party artificial intelligence or machine-learning model used to generate AI Outputs, selected and/or contracted by the Client.
Meta Platforms, Inc. and its related companies, including WhatsApp and any associated messaging, business, or API services.
The WhatsApp messaging platform and any related APIs, business services, or infrastructure operated by Meta Platforms.
All fees payable by the Client to Voxd for the Services, as set out in the applicable Order Form.

Any information disclosed by one party to the other in connection with the Services that is marked as confidential or would reasonably be considered confidential, excluding information that is public or lawfully obtained from a third party.
All applicable data protection and privacy laws, including the UK GDPR and the Data Protection Act 2018, as amended from time to time.
A day other than a Saturday, Sunday, or public holiday in England.
Communication in written form, including electronic communications, where expressly permitted under these Terms.

clauses.title: Entire Agreement
clauses.text: These Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between the parties in relation to the Services and supersede and extinguish all previous agreements, understandings, negotiations, assurances, representations, warranties, and arrangements, whether written or oral.

clauses.title: No Reliance on Pre-Contractual Statements
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges and agrees that, in entering into this agreement, it has not relied upon and shall have no right or remedy in respect of any statement, representation, assurance, or warranty (whether made innocently or negligently) that is not expressly set out in these Terms and Conditions.

clauses.title: Excluded Pre-Contractual Materials
clauses.text: Without limitation, the Client agrees that the following shall not form part of this agreement unless expressly incorporated in writing:

children.title: Sales Discussions and Demonstrations
children.text: Any sales discussions, demonstrations, presentations, or verbal explanations provided by Voxd prior to the commencement of the Services.

children.title: Written Communications
children.text: Any emails, instant messages, proposals, quotations, marketing materials, website content, or documentation provided prior to the effective date of these Terms.

children.title: Estimates and Projections
children.text: Any estimates, forecasts, projections, examples, performance indicators, or illustrative outputs, including but not limited to AI-generated examples or demonstrations.

clauses.title: No Guarantees or Promises
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that no guarantees, promises, or assurances have been made by Voxd regarding business outcomes, performance, accuracy of AI outputs, financial benefit, compliance, or suitability for any particular purpose, except as expressly stated in these Terms.

clauses.title: Variations Must Be in Writing
clauses.text: No variation, amendment, or addition to these Terms shall be effective unless agreed in writing and signed by an authorised representative of Voxd.

clauses.title: Misrepresentation
clauses.text: Nothing in this section shall exclude or limit any liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

clauses.title: Company Identity
clauses.text: Voxd AI LTD is a company incorporated in England and Wales with company registration number [PENDING].

clauses.title: Registered and Trading Address
clauses.text: The registered office and principal trading address of Voxd AI LTD is Wharf Cottage, Daneway, Sapperton, Gloucestershire, GL7 6LN.

clauses.title: Nature of the Business
clauses.text: Voxd provides bespoke AI-powered chatbot configuration and integration services for business clients.

clauses.title: Business-to-Business Services Only
clauses.text: The Services are provided strictly on a business-to-business basis. Voxd does not provide services to consumers and these Terms do not apply to individuals acting in a personal or consumer capacity.

clauses.title: Support and Communications
clauses.text: All operational support in relation to the Services is provided exclusively through the Voxd client portal. Voxd does not provide routine support via email or other communication channels.

clauses.title: Legal Contact
clauses.text: Legal notices and formal communications may be directed to james.beck@voxd.ai. Voxd reserves the right to update its legal contact details from time to time.

clauses.title: Interpretation
clauses.text: In these Terms and Conditions, unless the context otherwise requires:

children.title: Singular and Plural
children.text: Words in the singular include the plural and words in the plural include the singular.

children.title: Headings
children.text: Headings are included for convenience only and shall not affect the interpretation of these Terms.

children.title: Persons
children.text: References to a person include a natural person, corporate or unincorporated body (whether or not having separate legal personality).

children.title: Including
children.text: The words "including", "include", or "in particular" shall be interpreted as illustrative and shall not limit the meaning of the words preceding them.

children.title: References to Law
children.text: References to any law or regulation include that law or regulation as amended, extended, re-enacted, or replaced from time to time.

children.title: Writing
children.text: References to writing or written communication include electronic communications where permitted under these Terms.

children.title: Order of Precedence
children.text: In the event of any inconsistency between these Terms and an Order Form, the Order Form shall prevail only in respect of the commercial details expressly set out in the Order Form.

clauses.title: General Scope
clauses.text: Voxd provides bespoke AI-powered chatbot configuration, setup, and integration services in accordance with the specifications agreed with the Client.

clauses.title: Configuration and Integration Only
clauses.text: The Services are limited to the configuration and integration of chatbot solutions. Voxd does not provide the underlying artificial intelligence models, messaging platforms, hosting services, or third-party software unless expressly agreed in writing.

clauses.title: Client Specifications
clauses.text: The Services are delivered based on information, requirements, instructions, and materials provided by the Client. Voxd is not responsible for errors, omissions, or issues arising from inaccurate, incomplete, or misleading information supplied by the Client.

clauses.title: No Professional or Regulatory Advice
clauses.text: Voxd does not provide legal, regulatory, financial, compliance, or professional advice of any kind. The Client is solely responsible for obtaining independent advice in relation to its use of the Services.

clauses.title: No Guaranteed Outcomes
clauses.text: Voxd does not guarantee any particular business outcome, performance level, accuracy, revenue generation, cost savings, or commercial benefit arising from the use of the Services.

clauses.title: Excluded Services
clauses.text: Unless expressly agreed in writing, the following are excluded from the Services:

children.title: Third-Party Platforms and Accounts
children.text: The provision, management, approval, or operation of third-party platforms or accounts, including but not limited to WhatsApp, Meta, and LLM providers.

children.title: Content Creation and Moderation
children.text: The creation, approval, moderation, or ongoing review of chatbot content, responses, or outputs.

children.title: Legal or Regulatory Compliance
children.text: Ensuring compliance with applicable laws, regulations, industry standards, or platform policies.

children.title: Monitoring and Supervision
children.text: Ongoing monitoring, supervision, or manual review of chatbot interactions or outputs.

clauses.title: Changes to Scope
clauses.text: Any changes to the scope of the Services must be agreed in writing and may be subject to additional fees.

clauses.title: General Obligations
clauses.text: The Client is responsible for its use of the Services and for ensuring that such use complies with these Terms and all applicable laws, regulations, and platform policies.

clauses.title: Accuracy of Information
clauses.text: The Client warrants that all information, materials, instructions, data, and specifications provided to Voxd are accurate, complete, and lawful. Voxd shall not be responsible for any issues arising from inaccurate or incomplete information supplied by the Client.

clauses.title: Content and Outputs
clauses.text: The Client is solely responsible for all content, prompts, training data, workflows, and automated responses generated, processed, or delivered through the chatbot, whether created by the Client, Voxd, or generated by artificial intelligence.

clauses.title: Platform and Policy Compliance
clauses.text: The Client is responsible for ensuring compliance with the terms, policies, and acceptable use requirements of all third-party platforms and services used in connection with the Services, including but not limited to WhatsApp, Meta, and LLM providers.

clauses.title: Third-Party Accounts and Access
clauses.text: The Client is responsible for establishing, maintaining, and securing all required third-party accounts, credentials, permissions, and approvals necessary for the Services to operate.

clauses.title: Third-Party Costs and Charges
clauses.text: The Client is solely responsible for all fees, usage charges, overage costs, or other expenses incurred in relation to third-party services, platforms, or integrations used in connection with the Services.

clauses.title: Testing and Approval
clauses.text: The Client is responsible for testing and approving the chatbot configuration prior to deployment and acknowledges that any deployment or continued use constitutes acceptance of the configuration.

clauses.title: Lawful and Appropriate Use
clauses.text: The Client shall not use, and shall ensure that its end users do not use, the Services for any unlawful, misleading, abusive, harmful, or prohibited purpose.

clauses.title: Cooperation
clauses.text: The Client shall provide reasonable cooperation, access, and information as required by Voxd to perform the Services. Voxd shall not be liable for delays or failures caused by the Client's lack of cooperation.

clauses.title: Compliance with Terms and Laws
clauses.text: The Client shall use, and shall ensure that its end users use, the Services strictly in accordance with these Terms, all applicable laws and regulations, and all applicable third-party platform policies (including those of Meta, WhatsApp, and any LLM providers).

clauses.title: Prohibited Purposes
clauses.text: The Client shall not, and shall not permit any third party to, use the Services (including any chatbot, AI output, integration, or configuration) for any unlawful, misleading, deceptive, abusive, harmful, or prohibited purpose.

clauses.title: Prohibited Activities
clauses.text: Without limitation, the Client shall not use the Services, and shall ensure that its end users do not use the Services, to:

children.title: Unlawful or Harmful Activity
children.text: engage in, promote, facilitate, or assist any unlawful activity, including fraud, impersonation, harassment, discrimination, hate speech, threats, or exploitation;

children.title: Spam and Unsolicited Messaging
children.text: send, facilitate, or automate unsolicited, bulk, or spam communications, or otherwise breach applicable marketing, communications, or electronic messaging laws or platform rules;

children.title: Regulated or High-Risk Activities
children.text: provide or purport to provide legal, medical, financial, investment, insurance, credit, employment, or other regulated or professional advice, determinations, or recommendations, except where expressly permitted by law and appropriately authorised by the Client;

children.title: Misrepresentation and Deception
children.text: misrepresent the chatbot as a human, as Voxd, as Meta, or as an authorised professional, or make false, misleading, or unauthorised statements on behalf of the Client or any third party;

children.title: Platform Policy Breaches
children.text: violate or attempt to circumvent the terms, acceptable use policies, technical safeguards, or enforcement mechanisms of any Third-Party Service, including WhatsApp, Meta, or any LLM provider;

children.title: Intellectual Property and Confidentiality
children.text: infringe, misappropriate, or otherwise violate any intellectual property rights, confidential information, or proprietary rights of any third party;

children.title: Security and Abuse
children.text: attempt to interfere with, disrupt, probe, scan, or test the vulnerability of the Services, underlying infrastructure, or Third-Party Services, or to bypass any safeguards, guardrails, or restrictions;

children.title: Adversarial or Manipulative Use
children.text: intentionally attempt to manipulate, override, exploit, or subvert AI behaviour or safeguards, including through prompt injection, social engineering, or adversarial inputs, other than for legitimate testing approved by the Client;

children.title: Illegal or Inappropriate Content
children.text: generate, store, transmit, or distribute content that is unlawful, defamatory, obscene, discriminatory, abusive, or otherwise inappropriate for the intended business use.

clauses.title: Client Responsibility for Compliance
clauses.text: The Client is solely responsible for implementing appropriate internal policies, user instructions, disclosures, consent mechanisms, and safeguards to ensure compliance with this section.

clauses.title: Voxd's Rights
clauses.text: Voxd reserves the right, without liability, to suspend, restrict, modify, or terminate the Services, in whole or in part, where Voxd reasonably determines that the Client's use of the Services breaches or risks breaching this section, applicable law, or any third-party platform policy.

clauses.title: Material Breach
clauses.text: Any breach of this section shall constitute a material breach of these Terms for the purposes of {{section:suspension_and_service_availability}} (Suspension) and {{section:termination}} (Termination).

clauses.title: Indemnity
clauses.text: The Client shall indemnify Voxd in accordance with {{section:indemnity}} in respect of any claims, losses, damages, penalties, fines, costs, or liabilities arising from or related to any breach of this section.

clauses.title: Nature of AI and Inherent Limitations
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that artificial intelligence and machine-learning systems may produce outputs that are inaccurate, incomplete, misleading, inconsistent, inappropriate, offensive, or otherwise unsuitable. AI outputs may appear authoritative despite being incorrect.

clauses.title: No Warranties Regarding AI Outputs
clauses.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Voxd makes no warranties, representations, or guarantees of any kind in relation to AI outputs, including (without limitation) any warranty of accuracy, completeness, reliability, timeliness, legality, non-infringement, fitness for purpose, or that outputs will meet the Client's requirements.

clauses.title: Client Responsible for Use and Decisions
clauses.text: The Client is solely responsible for all reliance upon, use of, interpretation of, and decisions made based on any AI outputs. The Client shall ensure that appropriate human review, validation, and oversight is applied where required, including before acting on, publishing, or communicating any AI output.

clauses.title: No Liability for Anything the AI Says
clauses.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Voxd shall have no liability for any AI output (including any statement, response, recommendation, classification, action, or omission) generated, suggested, delivered, or communicated via the chatbot, whether to the Client, the Client's staff, or end users, and whether arising from prompts, training data, context, tools, integrations, or any other cause.

children.title: Non-Exhaustive Examples
children.text: This includes (without limitation) any liability for: (i) misinformation or hallucinations; (ii) offensive, defamatory, discriminatory, or harmful content; (iii) incorrect advice or instructions; (iv) failure to follow the Client's intended tone, policies, or scripts; (v) errors in understanding user messages; (vi) failure to escalate to a human; (vii) unintended commitments, refunds, pricing, or contractual statements made by the chatbot; or (viii) any outputs sent to the wrong recipient or at the wrong time due to context or automation.

clauses.title: No Professional Advice
clauses.text: AI outputs are not professional advice. Voxd does not provide legal, regulatory, medical, financial, accounting, or other professional advice through the Services. The Client must obtain independent professional advice where appropriate and must not permit the chatbot to be used as a substitute for professional judgement.

clauses.title: Client Controls, Guardrails and Approval
clauses.text: Where Voxd provides configuration options, templates, guardrails, escalation paths, or suggested policies, these are provided for convenience only. The Client is responsible for selecting, approving, testing, and maintaining the final configuration and ensuring it is suitable, lawful, and safe for its intended use.

children.title: Testing and Ongoing Monitoring
children.text: The Client is responsible for testing the chatbot before go-live and for ongoing monitoring of chatbot behaviour and outputs after deployment, including following any changes to the Client's business processes, products, services, pricing, policies, or applicable platform rules.

clauses.title: Underlying Model Provider Responsibility
clauses.text: Where the chatbot uses an underlying LLM or AI model provided by a third party selected and/or contracted by the Client, the Client acknowledges that the model provider is responsible for the operation, availability, and behaviour of that model. Voxd is not responsible for model performance, training, safety controls, filtering, or changes made by any model provider.

clauses.title: Prompt Injection and Adversarial Inputs
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that end users or third parties may attempt to manipulate AI behaviour (including by prompt injection, social engineering, or adversarial inputs). Voxd is not responsible for AI outputs resulting from such attempts. The Client is responsible for implementing appropriate safeguards, policies, and business rules to mitigate such risks.

clauses.title: Sensitive and Restricted Use Cases
clauses.text: Unless expressly agreed in writing, the Client shall not use the Services for high-risk or safety-critical purposes, including where outputs could reasonably be expected to cause harm if incorrect (for example: medical diagnosis/treatment, emergency response, legal determinations, financial or investment advice, credit decisions, or employment screening). Any such use is at the Client's sole risk.

clauses.title: Responsibility for Claims Arising from AI Outputs
clauses.text: The Client is responsible for handling complaints, disputes, chargebacks, and claims arising from chatbot interactions and AI outputs, including interactions with end users. This section is without prejudice to any indemnity obligations set out elsewhere in these Terms.

clauses.title: Mandatory Legal Carve-Out
clauses.text: Nothing in this section excludes or limits any liability that cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law, including liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

clauses.title: Use of Third-Party Services
clauses.text: The Services may rely on, integrate with, or interoperate with third-party services, platforms, APIs, software, infrastructure, or providers that are not owned or controlled by Voxd.

clauses.title: No Control or Responsibility
clauses.text: Voxd has no control over Third-Party Services and does not monitor, endorse, or assume responsibility for their operation, availability, performance, security, functionality, pricing, or compliance.

clauses.title: Client Relationship with Third Parties
clauses.text: The Client's relationship with any Third-Party Service provider is direct and independent of Voxd. The Client is solely responsible for entering into, maintaining, and complying with all agreements, terms, and obligations with such providers.

clauses.title: No Liability for Third-Party Services
clauses.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Voxd shall have no liability for any failure, outage, interruption, degradation, error, defect, delay, or unavailability of any Third-Party Service.

children.title: Examples of Excluded Liability
children.text: This includes (without limitation) any liability arising from: (i) service outages or downtime; (ii) API changes, deprecations, or versioning updates; (iii) changes to functionality or features; (iv) rate limits or throttling; (v) data loss, corruption, or delays; (vi) pricing or billing changes; or (vii) termination or suspension of third-party accounts.

clauses.title: Integrations Developed by Voxd
clauses.text: Where Voxd develops, configures, or maintains integrations with Third-Party Services on behalf of the Client, such integrations are provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis. Voxd does not guarantee ongoing compatibility or continued operation of any integration.

clauses.title: API and Platform Changes
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that Third-Party Services may modify, restrict, deprecate, or withdraw APIs, endpoints, permissions, data structures, or access requirements at any time. Voxd is not responsible for adapting integrations to accommodate such changes unless expressly agreed in writing and may charge additional fees for any required updates.

clauses.title: Security and Data Handling by Third Parties
clauses.text: Voxd is not responsible for the security, storage, processing, or handling of data by Third-Party Services. Any data transmitted to or processed by Third-Party Services is done at the Client's sole risk and subject to the terms of those third parties.

clauses.title: Third-Party Costs and Unexpected Charges
clauses.text: Voxd shall not be responsible for any costs, fees, overages, penalties, or unexpected charges imposed by Third-Party Services, including those arising from increased usage, pricing changes, or misconfiguration.

clauses.title: Service Impact Due to Third-Party Issues
clauses.text: Voxd may suspend, limit, or modify the Services where required due to issues, restrictions, or actions taken by Third-Party Services. Voxd shall not be liable for any resulting impact on the Client's operations.

clauses.title: No Guarantees or Service Levels
clauses.text: Voxd does not provide any service level commitments, uptime guarantees, or performance assurances in relation to Third-Party Services or integrations.

clauses.title: Chargeable Investigation and Support Time
clauses.text: Where the Client requests Voxd to investigate, diagnose, or attempt to resolve an issue that is caused by, relates to, or originates from a Third-Party Service (including outages, API changes, platform restrictions, configuration changes, or third-party errors), Voxd reserves the right to charge for its time and effort at its then-current rates, regardless of whether Voxd ultimately resolves the issue.

children.title: No Fault Requirement
children.text: Such charges may apply even where the issue is outside Voxd's control and is not attributable to any fault, breach, or failure by Voxd.

children.title: Notification and Approval
children.text: Where reasonably practicable, Voxd will inform the Client before incurring chargeable investigation time; however, the Client acknowledges that immediate investigation may be required to minimise disruption.

clauses.title: Mandatory Legal Carve-Out
clauses.text: Nothing in this section excludes or limits any liability that cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law, including liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

clauses.title: Use of WhatsApp and Meta Platforms
clauses.text: The Services may be delivered via or integrated with WhatsApp and related Meta Platforms. Voxd is not affiliated with, endorsed by, or acting as an agent of Meta or WhatsApp.

clauses.title: Client Relationship with Meta and WhatsApp
clauses.text: The Client's relationship with Meta and WhatsApp is direct and independent of Voxd. The Client is solely responsible for establishing, maintaining, and complying with all applicable terms, policies, and requirements imposed by Meta and WhatsApp.

clauses.title: No Control Over WhatsApp or Meta Services
clauses.text: Voxd has no control over the operation, availability, delivery, routing, or performance of WhatsApp or Meta services and does not guarantee message delivery, timeliness, or reach.

clauses.title: Policy, Feature, and Platform Changes
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that Meta and WhatsApp may modify, introduce, interpret, or enforce policies, technical requirements, pricing structures, or platform features at any time. Voxd is not responsible for any impact such changes may have on the functionality, availability, or performance of the chatbot or the Services.

clauses.title: Account Approval, Suspension, and Termination
clauses.text: Voxd is not responsible for WhatsApp account approval, verification, quality ratings, message tier limitations, blocking, suspension, restriction, or termination by Meta or WhatsApp, whether temporary or permanent.

clauses.title: WhatsApp Quality Ratings and Reputation
clauses.text: The Client is solely responsible for maintaining its reputation, quality ratings, messaging practices, opt-in mechanisms, and compliance with WhatsApp messaging guidelines. Voxd shall have no liability for any degradation of reputation, quality score, or messaging tier.

clauses.title: WhatsApp and Meta Fees
clauses.text: The Client is solely responsible for all fees, charges, message costs, penalties, or usage-based pricing imposed by WhatsApp, Meta, or any related service providers. Voxd is not responsible for unexpected, increased, or variable fees arising from messaging activity, policy changes, or pricing updates.

clauses.title: Message Delivery and User Reach
clauses.text: Voxd shall not be liable for failed, delayed, duplicated, throttled, or undelivered messages, or for any limitation on the ability to send or receive messages due to platform rules, rate limits, outages, or enforcement actions by Meta or WhatsApp.

clauses.title: Service Impact Due to Meta or WhatsApp Actions
clauses.text: Voxd may suspend, modify, or limit the Services where required due to actions, restrictions, or requirements imposed by Meta or WhatsApp. Voxd shall not be liable for any resulting impact on the Client's operations.

clauses.title: Mandatory Legal Carve-Out
clauses.text: Nothing in this section excludes or limits any liability that cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law, including liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

clauses.title: Fees
clauses.text: The Client shall pay all fees associated with the Services as set out in the applicable Order Form. All fees are exclusive of VAT and any other applicable taxes unless expressly stated otherwise.

clauses.title: Setup Fees
clauses.text: Any setup, onboarding, configuration, or implementation fees are payable in full and in advance. Voxd shall have no obligation to commence work or provide any Services until such fees have been received in cleared funds.

clauses.title: Monthly Service Fees
clauses.text: Monthly service fees are payable in advance and cover the ongoing provision of the Services as agreed between the parties.

clauses.title: Minimum Term
clauses.text: The Services are provided subject to a minimum initial term as specified in the applicable Order Form (the "Initial Term"). Unless expressly agreed otherwise in writing, the Client is committed to the Services for the full Initial Term.

clauses.title: Payment Method
clauses.text: Payment of monthly service fees shall be made by Direct Debit. The Client agrees to maintain a valid Direct Debit mandate for the duration of the Services.

clauses.title: Failure to Pay
clauses.text: If any payment is not received when due, Voxd reserves the right to suspend or restrict the Services immediately without notice until payment is received in full.

children.title: No Liability for Suspension
children.text: Voxd shall have no liability for any loss, damage, or disruption arising from the suspension or restriction of the Services due to non-payment.

clauses.title: Changes to Fees
clauses.text: Voxd reserves the right to vary its fees on reasonable notice to the Client. Any fee changes shall take effect at the start of the next billing period unless otherwise stated.

clauses.title: Third-Party Costs
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that fees payable to Voxd do not include costs charged by third-party providers, including but not limited to LLM providers, WhatsApp, Meta, or integrated services. All such costs are the sole responsibility of the Client.

clauses.title: Billing Disputes
clauses.text: Any billing disputes must be raised in writing within fourteen (14) days of the relevant invoice or charge. Failure to do so shall constitute acceptance of the charge.

clauses.title: No Set-Off or Withholding
clauses.text: The Client shall not withhold, offset, or deduct any amounts from fees due to Voxd for any reason, including disputes, alleged defects, or service interruptions.

clauses.title: Order Form Precedence
clauses.text: In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between these Terms and Conditions and an Order Form, the terms of the Order Form shall prevail solely in respect of the commercial details expressly set out in the Order Form.

clauses.title: Commencement of Term
clauses.text: This agreement shall commence on the date specified in the applicable Order Form or, if no date is specified, on the date the Services are first made available to the Client.

clauses.title: Initial Term
clauses.text: This agreement shall continue for the minimum initial term specified in the applicable Order Form (the "Initial Term"), during which the Client is committed to the Services and the associated fees.

clauses.title: No Early Termination During Initial Term
clauses.text: Unless expressly permitted under these Terms or agreed in writing by Voxd, the Client may not terminate the agreement for convenience during the Initial Term.

clauses.title: Continuation After Initial Term
clauses.text: Following expiry of the Initial Term, the agreement shall continue unless and until terminated in accordance with the notice provisions set out in these Terms or as specified in the applicable Order Form.

clauses.title: Notice Requirement
clauses.text: Any notice to terminate the agreement or the Services must be given in accordance with this section and shall only be effective if provided in writing.

clauses.title: Form of Notice
clauses.text: Termination notice must be provided by written communication through the method specified by Voxd for contractual notices and must clearly state the intention to terminate the Services.

clauses.title: Minimum Notice Period
clauses.text: Following expiry of the Initial Term, either party may terminate the agreement by giving not less than thirty (30) days' written notice, unless a different notice period is specified in the applicable Order Form.

clauses.title: Notice During Initial Term
clauses.text: Any notice served by the Client during the Initial Term shall not take effect until the end of the Initial Term and shall not relieve the Client of its obligation to pay all fees due for the remainder of the Initial Term.

clauses.title: No Refunds or Fee Reductions
clauses.text: The giving of notice, whether during or after the Initial Term, does not entitle the Client to any refund, credit, or reduction of fees already paid or payable.

clauses.title: Continuation of Services During Notice Period
clauses.text: Unless otherwise agreed in writing, the Services shall continue to be provided during any notice period and the Client shall remain liable for all applicable fees.

clauses.title: Services Provided As-Is and As-Available
clauses.text: The Services are provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis. Voxd does not guarantee uninterrupted, continuous, or error-free availability of the Services.

clauses.title: No Service Levels or Uptime Guarantees
clauses.text: Unless expressly agreed in writing, Voxd does not provide any service level agreements (SLAs), uptime commitments, response times, or availability guarantees.

clauses.title: Planned and Unplanned Downtime
clauses.text: The Services may be subject to planned or unplanned downtime, including for maintenance, updates, repairs, emergency work, or due to issues affecting third-party services or infrastructure.

clauses.title: Third-Party Infrastructure and Providers
clauses.text: Voxd shall not be responsible for downtime, delays, failures, or service degradation caused by third-party infrastructure, hosting providers, platforms, APIs, networks, or services used in connection with the Services, including those appointed or used by Voxd.

clauses.title: Right to Suspend Services
clauses.text: Voxd reserves the right to suspend, restrict, or modify the Services, in whole or in part, at any time where reasonably necessary to:

children.title: Non-Payment
children.text: address non-payment or suspected non-payment of fees;

children.title: Legal or Policy Requirements
children.text: comply with applicable laws, regulations, court orders, or platform policies;

children.title: Security and Risk
children.text: protect the security, integrity, or operation of the Services or third-party platforms;

children.title: Third-Party Issues
children.text: respond to restrictions, failures, or actions taken by third-party services, including WhatsApp, Meta, or LLM providers;

children.title: Misuse or Risky Use
children.text: prevent or address misuse of the Services or activity that may expose Voxd to legal, regulatory, or reputational risk.

clauses.title: No Liability for Suspension or Downtime
clauses.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Voxd shall have no liability for any loss, damage, cost, or disruption arising from any suspension, restriction, modification, downtime, or unavailability of the Services, regardless of cause.

clauses.title: No Refunds or Credits
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that no refunds, credits, service extensions, or fee reductions shall be due in respect of any suspension, downtime, or unavailability of the Services.

clauses.title: Mandatory Legal Carve-Out
clauses.text: Nothing in this section excludes or limits any liability that cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law, including liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

clauses.title: Termination for Cause
clauses.text: Either party may terminate this agreement with immediate effect by written notice if the other party commits a material breach which is incapable of remedy or is not remedied within fourteen (14) days of written notice.

clauses.title: Termination by Voxd
clauses.text: Voxd may terminate the agreement immediately if the Client becomes insolvent, ceases trading, poses legal or reputational risk, or breaches platform policies.

clauses.title: Effect of Termination
clauses.text: Upon termination, the Client’s right to use the Services shall cease immediately. Termination shall not affect accrued rights or liabilities.

clauses.title: No Refunds
clauses.text: All fees paid or payable are non-refundable. No refunds, credits, or partial refunds shall be issued under any circumstances.

clauses.title: Data Protection
clauses.text: Each party shall comply with applicable data protection laws, including the UK GDPR and Data Protection Act 2018.

clauses.title: Roles of the Parties
clauses.text: The Client acts as data controller and Voxd acts as data processor unless otherwise agreed in writing.

clauses.title: Data Processing Addendum
clauses.text: The Data Processing Addendum set out in {{schedule:1}} forms part of these Terms and Conditions.

clauses.title: Ownership
clauses.text: All intellectual property rights in the Services remain the property of Voxd or its licensors. No rights are transferred except as expressly stated in these Terms.

clauses.title: AI Outputs - Ownership (as between the parties)
clauses.text: As between Voxd and the Client, and subject to the Client's compliance with these Terms and payment of all applicable Fees, the Client shall own all right, title, and interest (if any) in and to the AI Outputs generated for the Client through use of the Services.

clauses.title: No Warranty of Originality or Non-Infringement
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that AI Outputs may be generated using artificial intelligence and machine-learning systems and may be similar or identical to outputs generated for other customers or third parties. Voxd makes no warranty or representation that any AI Output is original, unique, non-infringing, or free from third-party rights.

clauses.title: Client Responsibility for Review and Clearance
clauses.text: The Client is solely responsible for reviewing, approving, and determining whether any AI Output may be used, relied upon, published, communicated, or commercialised, and for obtaining any necessary rights, consents, licences, or permissions in connection with the Client's intended use of the AI Outputs.

clauses.title: Client Materials
clauses.text: The Client warrants that it has all necessary rights, licences, and permissions to provide to Voxd (and to any Third-Party Services used in connection with the Services) any prompts, scripts, content, data, documents, branding, trademarks, policies, or other materials supplied by or on behalf of the Client ("Client Materials"), and that the use of such Client Materials as contemplated by these Terms will not infringe or misappropriate any third-party rights.

clauses.title: Reservation of Rights
clauses.text: Except as expressly stated in these Terms, no intellectual property rights are granted or transferred. Voxd and its licensors retain all rights in and to the Services, including any underlying software, tooling, configurations, templates, methodologies, workflows, and know-how, whether developed before, during, or after the provision of the Services.

clauses.title: No Obligation to Defend or Indemnify
clauses.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Voxd does not provide any indemnity, warranty, or assurance in respect of any intellectual property infringement or alleged infringement arising from or related to AI Outputs, Client Materials, or the Client's use of the Services.

clauses.title: Confidential Information
clauses.text: Each party shall keep confidential any confidential information disclosed in connection with the Services.

clauses.title: Excluded Losses
clauses.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Voxd shall not be liable for indirect, consequential, or economic losses, including loss of profit, revenue, or data.

clauses.title: Liability Cap
clauses.text: Voxd’s total liability shall not exceed the fees paid by the Client in the three (3) months preceding the claim.

clauses.title: Indemnity Scope
clauses.text: The Client shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Voxd, its directors, officers, employees, contractors, and affiliates from and against any and all claims, demands, actions, proceedings, losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable legal fees) arising out of or in connection with:

children.title: AI Outputs
children.text: any use of, reliance upon, publication, communication, or distribution of any AI Outputs by or on behalf of the Client, including any claim that an AI Output is inaccurate, misleading, defamatory, discriminatory, unlawful, or harmful;

children.title: Intellectual Property Infringement
children.text: any claim that any AI Output, Client Materials, prompts, scripts, data, or content provided by or on behalf of the Client infringes, misappropriates, or otherwise violates any intellectual property rights or other proprietary rights of any third party;

children.title: Client Materials and Instructions
children.text: any Client Materials, instructions, workflows, configurations, or requirements supplied by or on behalf of the Client, including Voxd's use of such materials or instructions in accordance with these Terms;

children.title: Regulatory and Legal Compliance
children.text: the Client's failure to comply with applicable laws, regulations, or regulatory guidance in connection with its use of the Services, including data protection, marketing, communications, consumer protection, or sector-specific regulations;

children.title: Platform Policies and Third-Party Terms
children.text: any breach by the Client of the terms, acceptable use policies, or requirements of any Third-Party Services, including WhatsApp, Meta Platforms, or any LLM provider;

children.title: Misuse or Prohibited Use
children.text: any use of the Services that breaches {{section:acceptable_use}} (Acceptable Use and Prohibited Activities) or otherwise exposes Voxd to legal, regulatory, or reputational risk.

clauses.title: Application of Indemnity
clauses.text: The indemnity in this {{section:indemnity}} shall apply regardless of whether the relevant claim arises from: AI Outputs generated automatically or in response to prompts; actions or omissions of the Client, its staff, contractors, or end users; or the involvement of any Third-Party Services.

clauses.title: Voxd's Obligations
clauses.text: Voxd shall: promptly notify the Client of any claim for which indemnity is sought (provided that any failure to notify promptly shall not relieve the Client of its indemnity obligations except to the extent it materially prejudices the defence of the claim); and reasonably cooperate with the Client in the defence or settlement of such claim at the Client's expense.

clauses.title: No Admission of Liability
clauses.text: Nothing in this {{section:indemnity}} shall be construed as an admission of liability by Voxd or as a waiver of any rights, remedies, or defences available to Voxd.

clauses.title: Without Prejudice to Other Rights
clauses.text: The Client's indemnity obligations under this {{section:indemnity}} are without prejudice to, and shall not limit, any other rights or remedies available to Voxd under these Terms or at law.

clauses.title: Assignment by the Client
clauses.text: The Client shall not assign, transfer, novate, subcontract, or otherwise deal with any of its rights or obligations under these Terms without the prior written consent of Voxd (such consent not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed).

clauses.title: Assignment by Voxd
clauses.text: Voxd may assign, transfer, novate, or otherwise deal with its rights and obligations under these Terms, in whole or in part, without the Client's consent, including in connection with: (a) a merger, acquisition, reorganisation, or sale of all or substantially all of Voxd's business or assets; or (b) an assignment to an affiliate or group company.

clauses.title: Subcontracting by Voxd
clauses.text: Voxd may subcontract, delegate, or otherwise perform any of its obligations under these Terms through subcontractors, agents, or service providers, provided that Voxd remains responsible for the performance of the Services in accordance with these Terms.

clauses.title: No Release of Liability
clauses.text: Any subcontracting or assignment by Voxd shall not relieve Voxd of its obligations under these Terms.

clauses.title: Force Majeure Events
clauses.text: Neither party shall be liable for failure to perform due to events beyond reasonable control.

clauses.title: Right to Change
clauses.text: Voxd may update these Terms from time to time. Continued use of the Services constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.

clauses.title: Governing Law
clauses.text: These Terms are governed by the laws of England and Wales, and the courts of England and Wales shall have exclusive jurisdiction.
